title: 112_hr3163
content: The "Easy Voting Act of 2011" establishes a minimum early voting period for jurisdictions conducting early voting, amending the Help America Vote Act of 2002 to include requirements for states permitting early voting. The "Easy Voting Act of 2011" mandates a 14-day early voting period, including weekends, for states allowing early voting for Federal elections starting January 1, 2012. Additionally, a conforming amendment is made to the Help America Vote Act of 2002 regarding enforcement. The table of contents of the "Easy Voting Act of 2011" is amended to include a new item after section 303. SEC. 303B prohibits states from requiring state-issued identification for voting or registering to vote. An election official cannot demand a state-issued ID for voting in federal elections. This does not affect mail-in voter registration requirements. Each state must comply with this rule. Each State must comply with the requirements of this section starting January 1, 2012. A clerical amendment is made to the table of contents of the Act. SEC. 303C requires states to offer same-day voter registration and change of address services on election day. States must allow individuals to register and vote on the day of a Federal election, as per SEC. 303C. States must allow individuals to register and vote on the day of a Federal election, as per SEC. 303C. In such election, a registered voter who moves within the State can update their address at the polling place using a form provided by the State, and cast their vote for a Federal office. States must allow individuals to register and vote on the day of a Federal election. A registered voter who moves within the State can update their address at the polling place and cast a vote for a Federal office without the need for provisional ballots. States must allow individuals to register and vote on the day of a Federal election. The appropriate election official at the polling place shall transmit voter registration or change of address forms to the State election official along with the cast ballots. Each State must comply with these requirements starting January 1, 2012. States must allow individuals to register and vote on the day of a Federal election, including at early voting sites. The State must permit individuals to register to vote in the same manner as required on Election Day. The text chunk states that individuals must register to vote and vote on the day of the election in the same manner as required by the State. It also mentions providing change of address service in the same manner as required by the State.
